customer_addr:
9500 E Via De Ventura Suite A100
SCOTTSDALE, AZ 85256

citations.narrative:
During training on 12 November 2023 for Makani, a 20-year-old male flighted Green-winged macaw, the bird deviated
from his flight path next to an uncovered pool housing sharks. The bird flew over the pool and landed in the water,
flapping at the surface level no longer than 30 seconds before a trainer was able to rescue him. He was evaluated same
day by a veterinarian and determined to have no injuries and no evidence of aspiration of pool water. Handling of all
animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive cooling,
behavioral stress, physical harm or unnecessary discomfort.
Correct from this date forward of 28 November 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
There is no developed and documented plan for additional environment enhancement for nestlings, chicks or fledglings.
At time of inspection, a single African Penguin chick is being parent raised in a designated room with hutches, but there is
not a written plan for this additional environment enhancement. Failure to develop and document a plan for special
consideration birds may result in inadequate or intermittent care in promoting and addressing needs for nestlings, chicks
or fledglings. Certain birds must be provided special attention regarding enhancement of their environment in accordance
with the instructions of the attending veterinarian.
Correct by 28 December 2023.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
At time of inspection, there was no developed and documented plan for additional environment enhancement for birds
showing signs of psychological distress. An adult blue-and-gold macaw "Calypso" is under veterinary care for chronic
feather plucking affecting multiple body regions including legs and abdomen. Facility representatives report Calypso is
receiving additional environment enhancement, but the plan is not written. Failure to develop and document a plan for
special consideration birds may result in inadequate or intermittent care in promoting and addressing their psychological
well-being. Certain birds must be provided special attention regarding enhancement of their environment in accordance
with the instructions of the attending veterinarian. One of these special consideration groups are birds that show signs of
being in psychological distress through behavior or appearance.
Correct by 28 December 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
2.131(b)(1) 
   
Handling of animals. 
During training on 12 November 2023 for Makani, a 20-year-old male flighted Green-winged macaw, the bird deviated 
from his flight path next to an uncovered pool housing sharks. The bird flew over the pool and landed in the water, 
flapping at the surface level no longer than 30 seconds before a trainer was able to rescue him. He was evaluated same 
day by a veterinarian and determined to have no injuries and no evidence of aspiration of pool water. Handling of all 
animals shall be done as carefully as possible in a manner that does not cause trauma, overheating, excessive cooling, 
behavioral stress, physical harm or unnecessary discomfort. 
 
Correct from this date forward of 28 November 2023. 
3.154(c)(1) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
There is no developed and documented plan for additional environment enhancement for nestlings, chicks or fledglings. 
At time of inspection, a single African Penguin chick is being parent raised in a designated room with hutches, but there is 
not a written plan for this additional environment enhancement. Failure to develop and document a plan for special 
consideration birds may result in inadequate or intermittent care in promoting and addressing needs for nestlings, chicks 
or fledglings. Certain birds must be provided special attention regarding enhancement of their environment in accordance 
with the instructions of the attending veterinarian.  
 
Correct by 28 December 2023. 
3.154(c)(2) 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
At time of inspection, there was no developed and documented plan for additional environment enhancement for birds 
showing signs of psychological distress. An adult blue-and-gold macaw "Calypso" is under veterinary care for chronic 
feather plucking affecting multiple body regions including legs and abdomen. Facility representatives report Calypso is 
receiving additional environment enhancement, but the plan is not written. Failure to develop and document a plan for 
special consideration birds may result in inadequate or intermittent care in promoting and addressing their psychological

well-being. Certain birds must be provided special attention regarding enhancement of their environment in accordance 
with the instructions of the attending veterinarian. One of these special consideration groups are birds that show signs of 
being in psychological distress through behavior or appearance.  
 
Correct by 28 December 2023. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
